snippet: Massive Open Online Courses are free, non-degree programs that have been drawing top professors and are seen as a tool for democratizing higher education.
abstract: Massive Open Online Courses, non-degree programs with unlimited enrollment that are open to anyone with an internet connection, are attracting big-name professors and ever larger class sizes; one such class, offered by Stanford University on artificial intelligence, attracted 160,000 students from 190 countries; courses are seen as a powerful tool for democratizing higher education.
lead_paragraph: Massive Open Online Courses are free, non-degree programs that have been drawing top professors and are seen as a tool for democratizing higher education.

headline.seo: MOOCs, Large Courses Open to All, Topple Campus Walls
headline.main: Instruction for Masses Knocks Down Campus Walls
headline.print_headline: Instruction For Masses Knocks Down Campus Walls
